meaning_str.bing:
n. 蜘蛛
网络. 爬行器；网络蜘蛛；搜索引擎蜘蛛

爬行器；网络蜘蛛；搜索引擎蜘蛛

蜘蛛；三脚架（尤指台球用的）；蜘蛛形工具；网状漏勺
爬行；悄悄移动；设圈套；织网；搜集信息（如网络爬虫）

1.en: Incredible find: An orange spider, so different it has its own new genus, was one of the star discoveries of the project.
1.cn: 令人难以置信的发现：一只橙色的蜘蛛，如此与众不同，只得在分类系统上自成一属。它是考察项目的明星级发现之一。

2.en: 128Today, I looked down to see a tiny spider crawling on the inside of my leg, very close to my crotch.
2.cn: （这是个女的）今天我朝下看，发现一只蜘蛛在我的大腿内侧爬，很靠近我那里。

3.en: Moreover, if users need any of these technologies to follow the links, the spider won't be able to do so.
3.cn: 另外，如果用户需要这些技术才能使用链接，那么爬行器就无法沿着链接前进。

0.en: George is putting the spider to bed. Night night.
0.cn: 乔治把蜘蛛放在床上。晚安。

1.en: No, if it was a spider, Lenny would've flipped out.
1.cn: 不会的，如果真是蜘蛛，Lenny早就失控了。

2.en: So. You're the... Spider..Ling. Crime Fighting Spider... You're Spider Boy? Spider Man.
2.cn: 那么你是蜘蛛……娃？打击犯罪蜘蛛，蜘蛛男孩？蜘蛛侠。

3.en: Why would I flip out? Is it a spider? It's a spider!
3.cn: 我为什么会失控？不会是蜘蛛吧？就是个蜘蛛。

4.en: George likes the spider. The spider likes George. Peppa loves playing tea parties.
4.cn: 乔治喜欢蜘蛛，蜘蛛也喜欢乔治，佩琪喜欢举办茶会。

5.en: George is going to fill the teapot with water. George has found a spider in the sink. George wants the spider to be his friend.
5.cn: 乔治要把茶壶灌满水，乔治在水槽里找到了蜘蛛，他想要蜘蛛做他的朋友。

6.en: Cobwebs mean spiders and I don't like spiders. I do. Spiders catch flies and flies are horrid. Well, as long as I don't have to see a spider.
6.cn: 有蜘蛛网就意味着有蜘蛛，可是我一点都不喜欢蜘蛛。我喜欢，蜘蛛可以捉虫子，可是虫子很讨厌。好吧，只要别再让我看见蜘蛛就行了。啊，

7.en: Charlotte who? With the web, the spider she dies, she does. She has babies and dies.
7.cn: 哪个夏洛特？蜘蛛网，那只蜘蛛，她死了，她生了宝宝后就死了。

8.en: Mummy, his name is Mr. Skinnylegs. Oh. Mr. Skinnylegs is big, isn't he? Peppa and George like the spider. Night night. George is putting the spider to bed.
8.cn: 妈妈，我给它取了个名字，叫瘦腿先生。瘦腿先生个子挺大的，是吧？佩琪和乔治，喜欢蜘蛛。晚安。乔治把蜘蛛放在床上。

9.en: What the heck is this? A jar with a big spider in it, of course.
9.cn: 这是什么？当然是装着一只大蜘蛛的罐子啦。

10.en: A spider. Hello, Mr. Skinny Legs. Oh. Where have you gone? Find it. I don't want it in the house.
10.cn: 这是一只蜘蛛！你好啊！亲爱的瘦腿先生！你跑到哪去了？快找找，我不想房间里看见蜘蛛。

11.en: Eensey Weensey spider climbed up the water spout. Down came the rain and washed the Weensey out. Out came the sun shining and dried up all the rain. Eensey Weensey spider climbed up the spout again.
11.cn: 一只蜘蛛爬上了喷水口。大雨倾盆而下，把我们洗了个澡。太阳出来了，雨都晒干了。蜘蛛又爬上了壶嘴。

12.en: I never thought I'd say these words, but come on, nose spider!
12.cn: 我从没想过自己会说这些话，拜托你快来吧，鼻蜘蛛。

13.en: Yeah. Tell me those aren't the words of a man with a spider eating its way through his brain.
13.cn: 你们说这人是不是脑子被蜘蛛啃了才能说出这种话来。

14.en: Oh, he's very busy. Yes. It's hard work building a web. That's why you must never ever break one. If you do, the spider has to do all the work again. Yes, Daddy. Bye-bye, Mr. Skinny Legs.
14.cn: 哦，那么他肯定非常的忙碌。是的，他正在努力的织网。所以你永远不要去破坏蜘蛛网。如果蜘蛛网坏了，蜘蛛就要重新知网。好的爸爸，再见了瘦腿先生。

15.en: My turn. Peppa has made a spider. My name is Mr. Skinny Legs. Oops, scary.
15.cn: 让我来试试。佩奇做出了一只蜘蛛。你们好，我叫做瘦腿先生。喔哦，真吓人！

16.en: And we are laughing. Bigger. Like when I do Yoda walking into a spider web. Nailed it!
16.cn: 笑起来吧，再大一点，想象我学尤达走进蜘蛛网的样子，就是这个！

17.en: Irrational? All right. Well, I'll remember that the next time you freak out about a spider in your apartment.
17.cn: 愚昧? 下次你被家里的蜘蛛吓到，我们再谈这个话题。

18.en: What was I thinking giving Joey this big, gross, scary spider in such a poorly constructed cage?
18.cn: 我在想什么？送乔伊这么一个恶心的可怕的蜘蛛还用这么一个松散的笼子？

19.en: Hello, children, I hear you've found a little spider. I'll take him out of the bedroom so you two can play.
19.cn: 你们好，听说你们找到一只小蜘蛛，我过来把它拿走，这样你们就能玩了。
